home.intro: To me, software development is more than just writing code â€” it's about building systems, solving real problems, and shaping what's next.
home.techApproach: I combine modern technologies, original ideas, and user-centered design across every project I work on.
home.aiApproach: I don't just use AI tools â€” I design structured, creative workflows around them to unlock real productivity.
home.patents: I hold several patents (and pending ones), because innovation means thinking beyond code.
home.techStack: As a full-stack developer, I build robust, scalable applications using TypeScript, React, Tailwind, and Spring Boot.
home.hobbies: In my free time, I enjoy building games with Unity, designing interactive experiences, and exploring narrative mechanics.
home.philosophy: Every line of code should serve a greater system.
home.passion: I love building those systems â€” and making them meaningful.

aiApproach.title: My AI Approach
aiApproach.infoSectionTitle1: How Do I Use AI and Prompts?
infoSectionDesc1: I use artificial intelligence not just to generate outputs, but to systematically boost my productivity, improve code quality, and empower creative processes.

Each AI tool I use acts as a customized partner serving a specific purpose. I have integrated different AI solutions into my workflow for code development, component design, visual generation, project planning, game prototyping, patent analysis, and more.
In the cards below, you can see how I use each tool, the areas where I gain efficiency, and the custom prompt structures I have developed.
aiApproach.infoSectionTitle2: Beyond Code: A New Generation Engineering Thought System with AI
infoSectionDesc2: I position artificial intelligence not just as a tool, but as a thought partner that expands my engineering perspective. I integrate each AI solution I use with a strategy specific to its task domain, transforming it from a mere output-generating system into a "collective mind" with which I can think and build structures.
ğŸ§  Not Just Coding, But Building Systems

My work with Cursor AI is a good example. I'm not just creating components â€” I'm building component architecture, setting up principles like reusability, performance, and testability with GPT assistance. For instance, when developing a large Form library, I ask Cursor AI to scan UI behavior patterns, then revise code suggestions according to my principles. This way, AI becomes not just a "coder" but a "thinking" assistant.
ğŸ§¬ A GPT that Generates Patent Ideas? Yes.

I've transformed ChatGPT from a simple chatbot into purpose-specific GPTs. Import Editor: Monitors import groupings according to our team's established order. Data-Test-ID Validator: Analyzes missing or incorrect test IDs for UI testing processes. Patent Investigator: We've created a special GPT that scans national and international similarities of patent ideas I present in intellectual property processes. This greatly facilitates my work when converting ideas into technical documents.

Breaking down a task into subtasks might seem easy, but making it scalable is a different skill. With Claude, especially when developing component libraries, I work on planning edge cases, creating refactor strategies, and developing variant scenarios for UI states. This allows me to create a mental architecture before even starting to write code.
âš¡ Grok: Finding Clarity in Uncertainty

There are moments when you have to choose: performance or readability? This is where Grok comes in. For example, when deciding whether to switch from a complex useEffect chain to a custom hook, I explained both versions to Grok â€” it not only offered alternatives but also analyzed the trade-offs and made recommendations.
ğŸ¨ Muse: Where Visual Thinking Meets Code

In story-focused mini-games I develop with Unity, I use Muse not as an artist but as a "design partner." I generate elements like low-poly objects, isometric scene layouts, and environmental details that guide player attention, then arrange them within the scene. This process affects not just visual design but also in-scene interaction.
ğŸ§ª Artistic Prototyping with Fooocus Colab

I can quickly test scene drawings, sprite generation, and shading variants for my 2D game ideas with Fooocus. In art style experiments, I believe the game world and graphic language should be consistent, and I get intensive AI support to speed up this process.
ğŸ¤– Copilot: Silent Follower, Powerful Completer

Finding simple errors and auto-completing code are Copilot's known capabilities. But I use it more as an "assistant" that stays true to detailed work plans. In file structures with multiple modules, while developing tasks I previously planned with Claude, Copilot makes time-saving micro-interventions.
ğŸš€ Engineering with AI Means Not Just Using, But Designing

For me, artificial intelligence is not just a tool â€” it's an engineering principle. The right tool + the right use case = a transformative effect on the way I think. With every AI tool, I not only save time; I also redesign my way of thinking.

patents.title: Patents
patents.subtitle: My innovative solutions and patents

whatIsPatent.title: ğŸ§¾ What is a Patent?
whatIsPatent.description: A patent is a legal right granted to an inventor, giving them exclusive authority to make, use, or sell an invention for a limited period. It's not just a certificate â€” it's a declaration that your solution is original, useful, and innovative.

whyMatter.title: ğŸŒ Why Do Patents Matter?
whyMatter.description: Patents are vital for protecting original ideas, enabling R&D investments, increasing national innovation indexes, elevating corporate valuation, and creating licensing & collaboration opportunities.

whyWork.title: ğŸ§  Why I Work in This Field
whyWork.description: I believe the future belongs to multi-disciplinary thinkers â€” those who can see patterns across sectors, and create solutions that don't just solve problems, but redesign the way we live.
whyWork.description2: For me, invention is not an accident. It's a habit of observing, questioning, connecting and building.

areas.title: Key Focus Areas in Innovation
areas.description: In my intellectual property work, I prioritize societal benefit and sustainable innovation. Below are the main impact areas I focus on during my patent development processes.
items: ğŸ¶ Intelligent Systems for Music & Arts
areas.disclaimer: Due to ongoing applications, technical details of these projects remain confidential until official registration is complete.

turkey.title: ğŸ“Š Where Does Turkey Stand?
turkey.description: While global leaders such as China, the United States, and Japan dominate the patent landscape, Turkey is steadily building its own innovation ecosystem â€” with significant growth in both academic and industry-led applications in recent years.

globalLandscape.title: ğŸŒ Global Landscape (WIPO 2023 Data)
points: China alone accounted for over 43% of all patent filings globally.
The USA followed with around 19%, and Japan at 11%.
In contrast, Turkey's share is around 0.8% â€” yet showing a steady year-on-year increase.

growthTrends.title: ğŸš€ Growth Trends in Turkey
growthTrends.intro: According to TÃœRKPATENT (Turkish Patent and Trademark Office):
points: In 2023, over 9,500 national patent applications were filed in Turkey â€” a 400% increase compared to 2010.
University-originated patents and startup-backed filings are on the rise.

potential.title: ğŸŒŸ But There Is Real Potential
potential.description: Several international reports â€” including those by the World Bank and OECD â€” recognize Turkey as an "emerging innovation hub", especially due to:
points: Increasing government support for deep tech, defense, and green technologies

conclusion.title: ğŸ“ Conclusion
conclusion.description: Turkey may not be a global leader yet, but it's no longer an outsider. Every new patent filed by individuals, universities, and R&D teams is a step toward building a culture of innovation.

quotes.quote: The patent system added the fuel of interest to the fire of genius.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Invention is the most important product of man's creative brain.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

quotes.quote: Maybe we should patent the universe and charge everyone royalties for their existence.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: Know how to grow business, how to develop products, have patents and an undeveloped market that could be huge.
quotes.author: Mark Cuban

quotes.quote: If you didn't have patents, no one would bother to spend money on research and development.
quotes.author: James Dyson

quotes.quote: Patent protection is key to attracting investment and fostering innovation.
quotes.author: Michelle Lee

quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.quote: The patent is merely a license to be sued.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: Innovation is the specific instrument of entrepreneurship.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.quote: The patent system is the backbone of innovation.
quotes.author: Kalyan C. Kankanala

quotes.quote: I invent because I cannot help it â€“ new things just thrust themselves on me.
quotes.author: Beulah Louise Henry

quotes.quote: Intellectual property has the shelf life of a banana.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: Intellectual property is the oil of the 21st century.
quotes.author: Mark Getty

quotes.quote: The future is already here â€” it's just not evenly distributed.
quotes.author: William Gibson

cursor.description: TypeScript-based UI libraries design and code review assistant
cursor.detailedDescription:
ğŸ§  Building Systems, Not Just Writing Code
My work with Cursor AI is a good example. I'm not just creating components â€” I'm building component architecture, setting up principles like reusability, performance, and testability with GPT assistance. For instance, when developing a large Form library, I ask Cursor AI to scan UI behavior patterns, then revise code suggestions according to my principles. This way, AI becomes not just a "coder" but a "thinking" assistant.

modal.description: Cursor AI helps you design and review TypeScript-based UI libraries with AI-powered suggestions.

cursorPrompt.title: Code Quality and Architecture Review
cursorPrompt.prompt: As a software architect, review the following React/TypeScript code. Evaluate its compliance with SOLID principles, readability, and reusability. Prepare a detailed technical report for the development team, highlighting areas for improvement and any architectural issues you identify.

chatgpt.name: ChatGPT
chatgpt.description: Custom GPT for patent validation and technical writing
chatgpt.detailedDescription:
ğŸ§¬ A GPT that Generates Patent Ideas? Yes.
I've transformed ChatGPT from a simple chatbot into purpose-specific GPTs.

Import Editor: Monitors import groupings according to our team's established order.

Data-Test-ID Validator: Analyzes missing or incorrect test IDs for UI testing processes.

Patent Investigator: We've created a special GPT that scans national and international similarities of patent ideas I present in intellectual property processes. This greatly facilitates my work when converting ideas into technical documents.

modal.description: ChatGPT is used for patent validation, technical writing, and code review assistance.

claude.name: Claude
claude.description: Project planning and task breakdown assistant

Breaking down a task into subtasks might seem easy, but making it scalable is a different skill. With Claude, especially when developing component libraries, I work on:

Planning edge cases,

Creating refactor strategies,

Developing variant scenarios for UI states.

This allows me to create a mental architecture before even starting to write code.

modal.description: Claude helps with project planning, task breakdown, and documenting edge cases.

There are moments when you have to choose: performance or readability?
This is where Grok comes in.
For example, when deciding whether to switch from a complex useEffect chain to a custom hook, I explained both versions to Grok â€” it not only offered alternatives but also analyzed the trade-offs and made recommendations.

In story-focused mini-games I develop with Unity, I use Muse not as an artist but as a "design partner." I generate elements like:

Low-poly objects,

Isometric scene layouts,

Environmental details that guide player attention,

fooocus.name: Fooocus Colab
useCases: Generate high-quality images with Stable Diffusion
Fast and free usage on Colab
fooocus.detailedDescription:
ğŸ§ª Artistic Prototyping with Fooocus Colab
I can quickly test scene drawings, sprite generation, and shading variants for my 2D game ideas with Fooocus. In art style experiments, I believe the game world and graphic language should be consistent, and I get intensive AI support to speed up this process.

modal.description: Fooocus Colab is used for generating high-quality and unique images using Stable Diffusion.

fooocusPrompt.title: High-Quality Visual Generation for Games and Apps
fooocusPrompt.prompt: For a Unity-based game, generate a high-quality and original image that matches the concept description provided below. Include suggestions for color palette, style, and composition. Make sure the visual is detailed enough to be directly usable in-game.

copilot.name: Copilot
copilot.description: AI-powered code completion and suggestion assistant
copilot.detailedDescription:
ğŸ¤– Copilot: Silent Follower, Powerful Completer
Finding simple errors and auto-completing code are Copilot's known capabilities. But I use it more as an "assistant" that stays true to detailed work plans. In file structures with multiple modules, while developing tasks I previously planned with Claude, Copilot makes time-saving micro-interventions.

modal.description: Copilot is your AI pair programmer, offering real-time code suggestions and completions as you type.

copilotPrompt.title: Automated Code Completion and Refactoring Suggestion
copilotPrompt.prompt: Analyze the following code block and automatically complete and refactor it to make it more readable, maintainable, and performant. Summarize the purpose and functionality of the code in a brief explanation.

patentComparisonPrompt.title: Analysis and Comparison of Two Different Patent Documents
patentComparisonPrompt.prompt: Please analyze the IX.pdf file as a patent expert and focus on the differences with the Y.pdf file. Do these differences pose any obstacles to a healthy patent application? If not, explain why there would be no issues. If there are, summarize which sections might cause problems and why.
